metadata_entries.label: Extent
metadata_entries.content_html:
• The complete work is nearly extant except for a few small lacunae.
  • The edition contains a complete text of the known work.
  • The text fills 206 pages in the edition, with roughly half of each page dedicated to variant readings.

metadata_entries.label: Structure
metadata_entries.inline_text: The work consists of seventy stories in a frame story. The edition does not explicitly distinguish the frame story's introduction and conclusion with distinct sections.

metadata_entries.label: Work Description
metadata_entries.inline_text: The work's frame story takes place over seventy nights. In the frame, a pet parrot belongs to a young, lonely woman named Prabhāvatī, and he seeks to keep her faithful while her merchant husband, Madanavinoda, is away on business. Each night, when Prabhāvatī is tempted to meet a lover, the clever bird tells her a story meant to dissuade her. After seventy nights of such tales, her husband returns, and she has remained true, bringing the drama to a close. The stories feature clever protagonists who extricate themselves from difficult situations, especially women who outsmart men in episodes involving adultery.

metadata_entries.label: File Creation Method
metadata_entries.inline_text: I (Tyler Neill) produced this HANSEL edition by manually converting the original Word document to plaintext and then automatically adding XML markup. The text still needs a final proofread.

metadata_entries.label: Additional Notes
metadata_entries.content_html:
• Indian editions (e.g. Ramakant Tripathi, Vārāṇasī, 1966, basis of the GRETIL text) are based on this Simplicior text by Schmidt.
  • V. Gostishchev's original version of the file contains added chāyās from the Indian editions and other useful notes.
  • On the construction of the text, see the editor's 1890 PhD dissertation “Vier Erzählungen aus der Çukasaptati”, on Google Books
  • See also the editor's: “Anmerkungen zu dem Textus simplicior der Śukasaptati”, ZDMG 48, 1894, 580-628.
